intro: Eugenioides thwaitesii, commonly known as the mountain eugenia, is a species of flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, shaded environments. It produces small, berry-like fruits that are an important food source for various wildlife species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant plant.
